* Handles loading and saving tasks to a file.
* Creates a new Storage with the specified file path.
* @param filePath The path to the file for storing tasks.
* Loads tasks from the storage file.
* Creates the directory and file if they don't exist.
* @return An ArrayList of tasks loaded from the file.
* @throws BobException If there's an error reading the file.
throw new BobException("Hmm couldn't load saved tasks~");
* Parses a single line from the storage file into a Task object.
* @return The parsed Task, or null if parsing fails.
// Unknown task type, will return null
* Saves all tasks to the storage file.
* @param tasks The TaskList containing tasks to save.
* Converts a Task to its string representation for storage.
* Represents a task with a deadline.
* The deadline can be specified as a date (yyyy-mm-dd format) or as a string.
* Creates a new deadline task with the given description and due date.
* If the date is in yyyy-mm-dd format, it will be parsed as a LocalDate.
* Otherwise, it will be stored as a plain string.
* @param description The description of the deadline task.
* @param by The deadline date/time (preferably in yyyy-mm-dd format).
* Returns the deadline in a format suitable for storage.
* If the deadline was parsed as a date, returns it in yyyy-mm-dd format.
* Returns a string representation of this deadline task.
* If the deadline is a valid date, it is displayed in "MMM d yyyy" format.
* @return A string in the format "[D][status] description (by: date)".
* Represents an event task with a start time and end time.
* Creates a new event task with the given description and time range.
* @param description The description of the event.
* @param from The start time of the event.
* @param to The end time of the event.
public Event(String description, String from, String to) {
* Returns the start time of this event.
* Returns the end time of this event.
* Returns a string representation of this event task.
* @return A string in the format "[E][status] description (from: start to: end)".
return "[E][" + getStatusIcon() + "] " + description + " (from: " + from + " to: " + to + ")";
* Represents a task with a description and completion status.
* This is the base class for all task types (Todo, Deadline, Event).
* Creates a new task with the given description.
* The task is initially marked as not done.
* @param description The description of the task.
* Returns the status icon for this task.
* @return "X" if the task is done, " " (space) otherwise.
* Marks this task as not done.
* Returns whether this task is done.
* @return True if task is done, false otherwise.
* Returns the description of this task.
* Returns a string representation of this task.
* @return A string showing the task's status and description.
* Represents a list of tasks and provides operations to manage them.
* Creates a TaskList with the given tasks.
* @param tasks The initial list of tasks.
* Adds a task to the list.
* Deletes a task from the list at the specified index.
* @param index The 0-based index of the task to delete.
* Gets a task from the list at the specified index.
* @param index The 0-based index of the task.
* @return The task at the specified index.
* Returns the number of tasks in the list.
* @return The size of the task list.
* Returns the underlying ArrayList of tasks.
* Finds all tasks containing the given keyword in their description.
* @param keyword The keyword to search for.
* @return An ArrayList of tasks matching the keyword.
* Represents a todo task without any date/time attached.
* Creates a new todo task with the given description.
* @param description The description of the todo.
* Returns a string representation of this todo task.
* @return A string in the format "[T][status] description".

* Loads and provides random motivational quotes from a text file.
* Creates a new CheerLoader and loads quotes from the resource file.
* Loads quotes from the cheer.txt resource file.
// Fallback quotes if file not found
* Adds the given quotes to the list.
* Adds fallback quotes in case the file cannot be loaded.
"Keep going  even the best programmers started out writing 'Hello World'!",
"You've got this! Your future self will thank you for not giving up today.",
"Every expert was once a beginner. Keep coding!"
Keep going  even the best programmers started out writing 'Hello World'!
Code is like humor. When you have to explain it, it's bad.
First, solve the problem. Then, write the code.
It's not a bug  it's an undocumented feature!
The best error message is the one that never shows up.
Debugging is like being the detective in a crime movie where you are also the murderer.
Every expert was once a beginner. Keep coding!
Your code doesn't define you, but your persistence does.
One line at a time, you're building something amazing!
Stuck on a bug? Take a boba break and come back stronger!
Remember: Stack Overflow was built by people who also got stuck.
The only way to learn a new programming language is by writing programs in it.
Simplicity is the soul of efficiency.
You're doing great! Even semicolons fear your determination.
Programs must be written for people to read, and only incidentally for machines to execute.
The function of good software is to make the complex appear to be simple.
Talk is cheap. Show me the code!
Any fool can write code that a computer can understand. Good programmers write code that humans can understand.
You've got this! Your future self will thank you for not giving up today.
// Use a temp directory so tests don't interfere with real data
// Positive: adding a todo should confirm the task was added
String response = boba.getResponse("todo buy boba tea");
// Positive: adding a deadline should include task details in response
// Positive: listing tasks should show all added tasks
// Positive: marking a task should confirm it was completed
// Negative: marking an invalid index should show error
// Negative: an unknown command should show a helpful error
// Positive: bye command should return a farewell message
// Negative: todo with empty description should show error
// Positive: find should return matching tasks
// Negative: find with no matches should say so
// Positive: delete should remove a task and confirm
// Positive: cheer command should return a motivational quote
// Positive: adding tasks should increase the size correctly
// Positive: deleting a task should return it and decrease the size
// Negative: deleting at an out-of-bounds index should throw an exception
// Positive: find should return tasks matching the keyword (case-insensitive)
// Negative: find with no matching keyword should return an empty list
// Positive: constructing with existing tasks should preserve them
